inn1.comm: and all that buildup ends with a rather ant-climatic wide down the leg side
lets this one sail through from outside off to the keeper
130 kph, fuller length ball which is squirted away to the leg side via a mishit
129 kph, gets an inside-edge to this fuller length going across the batsman, and then curling in to strike just outside off. Definite edge on the inside of the bat as HotSpot is displayed
129 kph, simply content to allow this length ball slanting across to go through to Ronchi
131 kph, tentatively drives this length ball going across straight to the man at mid off
130 kph, manages to sneak a single down fine leg with a clip off the pads
138 kph, reaction from the crowd as this one screams past the edge off Dimuth's bat, who was poking at it rather half-heartedly
144 kph, into the 90s now as this one targets the body of Dimuth, who is able to whisk it away to fine leg
144 kph, length on middle and off which is tucked away to the leg side by a watchful Dilshan
146 kph, plays a typical Dilshan slap through the covers on the up to deep extra-cover, with the fielder doing well to track it back before the boundary
145 kph, this time on the pads of Dimuth as he glances to deep fine leg
145 kph, doesn't quite middle this pull which he intended to get through long on, with mid on getting behind it soon after
133 kph, and the first glimpse of the French cut as this one streaks away from the inside-edge towards backward square
134 kph, looked a touch late on this length ball going down the pads, with this one nipping away from him as he brought the bat down. Looks like it hurt him a bit too, but he is a strong character
136 kph, honing on the pads as this is flicked away efficiently to deep fine leg
134 kph, pitches this one up just outside off as this curls back dangerously to the off stump, but not enough to tickle timber. Collective gasp rings out across the oval
133 kph, turned away off the back foot towards deep backward square for one

133 kph, initially looked to clatter this back of a length outside off through the covers, before holding back at the last second as he went down the pitch, with Ronchi doing well to complete the take from behind
143 kph, leg side ball which is surprisingly not called by the umpire. Perhaps it nicked the pad on the way over?
145 kph, opens the face to run this length ball outside off to third man
146 kph, solidly behind this just back of a length outside off
144 kph, nicely behind this length ball which carries beautifully off the deck
145 kph, presents the outside edge before pulling back in to this just back of a length delivery on a fourth stump channel
147 kph, tries to force away a shot on the up through the covers, but doesn't quite time it so

133 kph, first piece of action today as Southee pitches this one up on a middle stump line which shapes back in before striking the pad. Southee goes up for the appeal but this appeared to be shaping down the leg side anyways, so it is turned down

134 kph, almost a carbon copy but this time it just looked out, and the umpire corroborates with the raise of the finger. Dimuth wanted to review as he went to his partner, but Dilshan sent him right away to the dressing room. Ends a torrid stay at the crease for the left-hander
131 kph, shows good awareness of his off stump as he allows this one shaping in from outside off at a full length, to go through to Ronchi
134 kph, steered straight to the fielder at mid off by Sangakkara
130 kph, short off a length and on the stumps as this is defended away
131 kph, defended away to the fielder at point to end the over
140 kph, steers this quicker ball towards third man
148 kph, short of a length on the body which is parried away off the back foot towards backward point
141 kph, turned away off the back foot to the leg side by Sangakkara
150 kph, fastest of the day so far as this is defended off the front foot to the man at gully
148 kph, looked to heave this fuller length ball on and around off through long on, but ends up inside-edging onto the pads, with the ball rolling harmlessly towards point
142 kph, short one going down the leg side as the umpire gets to stretch his arms a bit
140 kph, stands tall as he defends this with soft hands to the off side
134 kph, splays this one well wide of off stump, as the ball goes across Sangakkara, but the umpire is unmoved

132 kph, surprised the experienced left-hander with a bouncer which Sangakkara instinctively gloves as he looks towards self-preservation. This results in the ball bobbling high over the keeper and backward square to find the boundary
133 kph, this time unleashes the fuller ball which is guided straight to the cover fielder
134 kph, fails to find the gap through the covers as he drives

129 kph, tries the same plan from the second ball, except this time it sits up comfortably enough for Sangakkara to rock back and pull this in a flash to find yet another boundary through the leg side
130 kph, safely negotiates the final ball of this over from Southee
short of length delivery on off, Dilshan goes back and pulls it to to deep mid-wicket for a couple
142 kph, defended away on the front foot by Dilshan
149 kph, tries to force away a drive through the covers, but is late on it

148 kph, that's more like it from Dilshan. Gets high on his tippy-toes as he cuts this away on the up through extra-cover. This looks like it just might beat Brendon to the boundary, but he puts in an ambitous drive which just pulls the ball back, before he continues to roll onto the advertising hoarding. I can feel the concern from the NZ team physio all the way from here. That would have had a few NZ fans worried I am sure as he got up from that
148 kph, in the slot and Sangakkara displays that lovely bended knee cover drive which just races across the grass to the boundary
145 kph, fires in another fuller one just outside off which Sangakkara fails to get away
131 kph, leans in before driving this through long on powerfully to find the boundary. Dilshan could be ratcheting up here, which is ominous for the hosts
132 kph, is late on this fuller one on the pads, as he fails to get the clip away through midwicket
131 kph, presents a slightly angled bat as this is pushed down to mid off
134 kph, gets the line horribly wrong as the umpire signals wide to the crowd
132 kph, doesn't seem to have his radar set just yet. Wide signalled by the umpire
133 kph, runs this one outside off to third man to rotate the strike

130 kph, short and punished by Sangakkara as he shifts his weight onto the back foot before rolling his wrists to find the midwicket boundary. Complete control of that as the execution of it was just so fluid and pleasing to the eye
132 kph, sensibly shoulders arms to this length ball nipping away outside off
128 kph, called one for the over as this bouncer is well out of Dilshan's grasp as he looks to go through the leg side
128 kph, this time slipping down the leg side as Dilshan has a glance, with the ball catching the pad on the way to the keeper. NZ have a shout, but it is turned down by the umpire
129 kph, defended away by the batsman
135 kph, squirted away off the back foot through the leg side. This one hit high on the splice as he looked to get it away
136 kph, attacks this shorter one from Mitchell as he hooks this one fine to find the boundary in a flash. Nice aggression from Dilshan on display at the Saxton
137 kph, defends with the straightest of bats back to the bowler
127 kph, gentle loosener down the leg side which is clipped with ease to deep backward square
129 kph, driven firmly by Sangakkara to long off
131 kph, look to steer this fuller one past mid on with a push, but the fielder is able to get his hand on it with the ball just getting past, but losing a lot of its pace in the process
132 kph, shifts onto the back foot before driving this away through the covers, with one of the fielders putting in a dive to try and cut it off
130 kph, length on the pads which is tucked away towards fine leg
131 kph, fiercely cut away off the back foot through backward point to find the boundary. Dilshan looking a little more fluent now
136 kph, delivers a barnstormer of a bouncer which leaps high over everyone in question to find the other sight screen. That took off higher than MJ in a dunk contest
141 kph, better from Mitchell, and the pace is good too! this one targeting just outside off as Sangakkara gets solidly behind it
139 kph, shifts his line a touch closer to middle as Sangakkara remains resolute
140 kph, driven sweetly through the covers, but cut off by one of the fielders on the off side
137 kph, nicely tucked away off the back foot towards midwicket for an easy single
136 kph, same result, this time inverted as Sangakkara adds one more to his already enormous ODI run-tally
138 kph, pitched up from Mitch, and steered expertly by Dilshan through midwicket to find yet another easy single. Doesn't seem to be any impetus on the part of NZ to force the issue at the moment
fuller length outside off which is slapped away towards point
crashed away off the back foot towards the covers, but doesn't quite find his timing
defended away off the back foot in the general direction of the bowler
Sangakkara decides he has had enough of this gentle medium pace as he waltzes down to clatter Elliott high over cow corner for the first six of the innings
slips in a slower ball this time which Sangakkara is wise to as he defends
slips what he probably perceives as a bouncer, but more of a long hop which Sangakkara obliges by bending well over in front to evade it
flighted on middle and leg and defended carefully from the crease by Dilshan
invites Dilshan to come down as he drives this on the up to long off
tucked away off the back foot towards backward square by Sangakkara
pushes at this one which stops at him from outside off uppishly as the ball spoons temporarily in the air on the off side
finds the gap on the off side to pickup a single
drags this on middle and off as this is steered to long on by Dilshan
fails to get away this leg side delivery as the ball ends up at mid on
manages to find the gap through point with a steer off the back foot
this time opens the face to run this to the gully fielder
punched away on the up but locates the man at cover
waits on this one before driving firmly to deep extra-cover. Poor backing up allows for an additional welcome run for the tourists
delivered well wide of off stump as the umpire calls wide
defended away on the front foot and with soft hands by the experienced left-hander
defended away off the back foot, but finds mid on straight away
looks to force the issue with a slap through the off side, but is late on it
goes down the leg side as this is eased away to backward square
steered firmly by Sangakkara on the front foot to long on
slightly rushed as he gets the bat down to this floated delivery from Vettori
gets nicely back in his crease before cutting away through third man, but not enough to find the boundary
and he starts off play after drinks with a leg side delivery which is tickled behind to find the boundary
defended away with soft hands towards the vicinity of point, with the two running hard to complete the risky single, with the call made well in advance
onto the front foot as this is steered straight to short mid off
slightly wide outside off as this is cut away off the back foot towards sweeper cover
defended away to the leg side by Sangakkara to pickup yet another single
glanced away fine by Dilshan to deep fine leg to end a good over for Sri Lanka
almost manages to chop one onto the stumps as this is fended away off the back foot
driven towards long off by Dilshan to get off strike
turned away on the front foot to pinch a single through the leg side
defended with a dead, straight bat towards the off side
stays in the crease as he works this off the back foot to the off side
gets down before working this away to long off to end another tight over for NZ
manages to turn this one away on leg stump to midwicket for one
defended carefully by the batsman to Williamson
gets down the track before guiding this to long on
brings up the team 100 with a shimmy down the pitch before lifting Kane high over extra-cover to find a boundary
Dilshan manages to pickup an easy single through long on
safely negotiates the final ball of this Williamson over to pickup a single through long off
defended on the front foot by Sangakkara, and with soft hands
not quite in control of the shot as he advanced down to clear mid off, with the fielder in the circle, but he is able to get just enough elevation to find the desired result
this time uses his nous to find a boundary with an expertly-placed chip through midwicket. Also brings up his fifty in the process. Looking very good today is Sanga
firmly pushes at this fuller one on middle and leg, with the ball going down to long on
uses his feet to get to the pitch of the ball, before fending it away
worked away to long off to end the over

and New Zealand have struck against the run of play! Dilshan, looking to chip one floated in by Kane just outside off, ends up finding short mid off on the full, with the fielder barely able to contain himself as he completed the straightforward take. Big wicket that, but not the one they would have ideally wanted with Sangakkara rooted at his end
defended carefully by Mahela to get through the first ball
looks to glide this one off the back foot through the slip, but the fielder is behind it
given room to maneuver this through backward point to get himself underway

sweeps hard at this fuller one going down the leg side, but ends up offering a chance to McClenaghan at backward point, who ends up shelling the chance. Would have been a significant double-blow had it come off for NZ!
picks up the inevitable single down to long on
manages to work this away just behind square on the off side
defended away from the crease by Mahela
played with the softest of hands as this is directed away to the off side
tries to pickup the gap through backward square, but fails to do so
safely negotiated by the batsman, this time to the leg side
turned away gently to the leg side, but can't quite pinch the single
reaches out at this wide one turning away from outside off, but finds backward point
onto the front foot as he steers this to long off
floated up just outside off and sent high over cow corner by Mahela as he hits this so cleanly. Didn't take Mahela long to find his feet
fended away to the off side sensibly by the batsman
manages to pickup the single through long on to get off strike
firmly pushed at by the batsman as long off comes into play

pitches this one on middle and leg, with Sangakkara looking to sweep this round the corner, but ends up getting struck on the pad. Vettori goes for the shout, but they decide this may well have pitched outside leg, which turns out to be the case
gets nicely behind this fuller one from Vettori as the ball is blocked away
defended by the batsman with soft hands to the leg side
utliises the angle of the delivery to get this away around the corner to fine leg

nicely forward to flick this through midwicket, but finds the fielder at silly mid on who stops it and then throws a return at the non-striker's. Would have been good as gone for the non-striker who was short of his crease. And that fielder, surprise, surprise, is Guptill too
floated up on off, Sangakkara defends
driven away by Mahela, which at first didn't appear to have the legs on it as it raced away, but it just about beats the fielder to the deep extra-cover
stays in the crease as he tucks this away to the leg side
punched off the back foot through long off to pickup one
once again played away towards short midwicket, with McCullum stopping it quickly by predicting the right path of the ball as he went to his right
defended by the batsman to the leg side
tries to work this around the corner to deep backward square, but finds the fielder instead
floated by Vettori and Sangakkara obliges as this lands in the zone for him to unfurl another bended-knee cover drive which whistles to the ropes
this time negotiated away carefully to the leg side by Sangakkara
on the back foot as this is played away softly to the off side, with the intention of picking up a drop single. Held back the pace on this one too did Vettori
this time turned to the leg side, but can't get the run he sought
this time finds the gap on the off side behind square to get the single
waits on it before steering this straight to mid on
glances this one to deep fine leg for one
on the back foot as he gets this away through long on
steered expertly through the gap at cover
eased away through midwicket by Mahela for one
doesn't get this one quite right as he looks to chip this through long on, with the ball spooning high as it hit the higher end of the bat, but landing safely in the region
whisked away on the front foot through backward square leg
136 kph, sends across a length ball which gets good carry as Mahela has a lazy waft at it as an after-thought
138 kph, brings up the length as this time Mahela is able to crunch this past backward point on the hop, but not enough for it to get past third man
137 kph, gets nice and tall as he fends this one away outside his off stump
137 kph, delivered on the same line, perhaps a touch shorter, as Mahela weaves out of the way
132 kph, slips in the bouncer which has Mahela evading out of its path
136 kph, punched firmly by Mahela to the man at extra-cover to end the over
quicker one on off and middle, Sangakkara pushes it back to the bowler off the front foot
gets onto the back foot before punching this away through the covers
flighted on middle and sent the distance by Mahela as he launches into another clean strike over midwicket
shows his class this time by opening the face to this one pitched outside off, with the ball just being pulled back before reaching the third man boundary
slips it down the leg side as Kumar fails to work it round the corner
pitched up and driven firmly by Sangakkara to the man at long off
137 kph, length on off stump which is defended away to the off side
138 kph, nicely forward as he executes the drop single to perfection, steering this close to the body on the leg side, and with soft hands
135 kph, given an opportunity to bend the knee as he scythes this one through the covers
134 kph, tries to locate the gap past backward point, but is thwarted in his effort
131 kph, sends down a bouncer which is well over Mahela's head as the square leg umpire gives the signal
134 kph, tries him with a bouncer again, this time the ball is fended to the leg side, but not at all in control
steers this one to the leg side with soft hands to pickup another useful single
played tentatively to the leg side by Sangakkara
shimmies down before hitting this one straight back to the bowler
not at all in control as he looks to lift this through midwicket, but instead gets it more square off the wicket on the leg side
guided on the front foot firmly down to long off
looks to utilise the anger to sweep this round the corner, but finds leg slip
turns this one through backward square leg to find the single he wanted
140 kph, gets some movement away after pitching on a length, with Sangakkara punching this away through the covers
141 kph, looks to deposit Milne high over midwicket, but ends up getting a leading edge which flies high to extra-cover, but with no fielders placed nearby, it ends up being a safe shot
150 kph, sends away this thunderbolt with an effortless flick square off the wicket on the leg side to find the boundary in a flash
149 kph, this one is delivered outside off and Mahela uses the space to run this uppishly through third man, but not well enough to get it through
147 kph, gets nice and tall as he endeavours to glide this one past gully
141 kph, gets nicely under this short one from Milne to end the over
fended away off the back foot by Mahela
pushed through by Vettori outside off as Mahela takes a step before lifting this high over extra-cover
excited shout from Ronchi as he takes this one down the leg side, with Sangakkara appearing to have got something  on it. No wide signaled from the umpire either, so that is interesting
executes the single down to long on with perfection
turned away off the back foot through midwicket for a couple
hangs on the back foot as he fends this away to the off side

141 kph, and all his good work comes to an end as he is obliged to go after a fuller one in the slot, looking for his trademark cover drive, but instead finds Guptill at silly mid off, who takes it with no fuss. Looks like the only way he was going to get out. Beautiful knock that from Sangakkara

146 kph, Milne may just have another one here as he gets Mathews to glove at one going down the leg side at an awkward height. The umpire is unmoved when NZ go up for the appeal, but replays show that Mathews indeed got something on it, and it wasn't glove, but bat, so the decision is overturned
146 kph, let down from the Saxton Oval crowd as this one goes across Lahiru with a back of a length delivery which shapes away
150 kph, pitches it up now as Thiriammne gets away with a streaky shot that screams past what would have been gully to find a path towards the third man boundary

149 kph, slips in the fuller one down the leg side as the umpire remains unmoved. Mahela is wondering why a wide wasn't called, and the answer is, because he actually did get an edge on it, but because NZ did not go up more vociferously for the appeal, this one ended up not being taken as seriously
141 kph, ends up running this one towards third man, who is forced to go squarer to retrieve the ball
safely defended on the front foot by the batsman
tries to make room to cut away but backward point is able to stop it in its tracks
defended with soft hands towards Vettori
pushed away off the back foot towards the direction of point as Mahela is able to pinch the single
defended with a nice high elbow to the off side
almost offers up a chance to the slipper as he looks to run this down third man
141 kph, on the back foot as this is defended with a dead, straight bat
139 kph, turned away off the back foot to the leg side for an easy single
143 kph, overpitched on middle and off as Thirimanne uncorks a drive which cannons into mid off
145 kph, has a push at this fuller length ball, with mid off getting behind it
143 kph, short of a length and with some good carry as Ronchi collects from behind
143 kph, gets this one into the ribcage as Thirimanne fends away
steered away by Mahela to the man at long on
manages to squirt away a single on the leg side
tries to maneuver a single through the leg side with a glance down fine leg
on the back foot as this is cut away straight to cover
shimmies down and then lifts Kane elegantly high over extra-cover to pick up his third six, and more importantly, his fifty as well
sensibly eases this next one down to long on to retain the strike
131 kph, short of a length outside off which is run down towards the third man region
131 kph, uses the angle across him to glide this to third man
134 kph, once again tries to run it down, but this time doesn't quite get it away
134 kph, runs this one outside off to the fielder at third man
133 kph, sends this one outside off screaming to the man at point
132 kph, once again worked away to the third man region to end the over
131 kph, driven firmly on the front foot by the batsman to long off
132 kph, looks to turn this one away through the leg side, and manages to pickup the single
133 kph, glides this one outside off to the fielder at gully
134 kph, fuller one which is timed beautifully with a push through long on to find the boundary. Has been a class above everyone else today has Mahela
136 kph, another drive, this time to long off, but hits it a lot more crisply than he intended to
134 kph, eased off the pads to the leg side, but is stopped by a throw from the midwicket fielder
133 kph, steers this first one through third man to get Lahiru on strike
130 kph, intially looked to pull this shorter one through midwicket before deciding to ramp it at the last second, but is late on it. Looks quite furious as he walks away to talk to himself
131 kph, and he almost gives it away with an ill-advised heave over mid on, with the timing not at all in it as the ball just carried over the keeper to find the boundary
133 kph, cut away firmly by Mahela off the back foot through third man
131 kph, nice sound of the bat as this one was punched through the covers by the elegant left-hander
129 kph, slices this one away uppishly through the gully region, but is fortunate this did not go to hand
138 kph, if you are going to flash, then flash hard. Goes after this back of a length, with the ball beating the keeper to find the third man boundary
135 kph, shifts the line closer to the body as this is driven straight to mid off
133 kph, gets forward to work this away square off the wicket on the off side
128 kph, short one on middle and leg which leaps high over Mahela, yet, for some reason, is not called wide
133 kph, runs this back of a length outside off towards backward point
138 kph, clipped away on the front foot through the leg side
133 kph, not sure what Lahiru was thinking as he looked to follow after this length ball going across him, almost giving away an edge to Ronchi as the ball sailed through
130 kph, pulls this in front of square on the leg side for one
126 kph, slips in a wide yorker which has Mahela reaching out to try and bring about runs, but finds the backward point fielder
128 kph, honing on the pads at a fuller length as Mahela clips this behind to backward square
130 kph, turned away off the pads as he looked to run a drop single, which the pair are able to do
132 kph, not really behind this heave through cow corner, with this one just managing to get away after being miscued. Still brings about a boundary though
132 kph, driven firmly by Lahiru towards long off, with McCullum picking it up from and firing in a throw in one fluid motion, but failing to knock over the woodwork
134 kph, short and ramped effectively with a flick over the slips to find the boundary. Just sublime batting from this master blaster
133 kph, picks up two runs through midwicket with an easy clip

136 kph, what has Mahela done here? Looks like he has managed to slice this in such a way as to get this to bounce over backward point to find the boundary at third man. Unbelievable execution to not only get it over but find the placement as well. How do you stop this?
135 kph, this time turned away to the leg side for a single. This has been just classy batting from the right-hander. Has controlled this innings beautifully
136 kph, slips in an almost-yorker length delivery which ends up getting inside-edged onto the pads by the left-hander
133 kph, starts off with a length ball going across the batsman as this is fended away to the off side
134 kph, cut away behind of square on the off side for one
131 kph, shuffles over to his off stump when he sees the line cramming him for room on the leg side, and utilises this newly found space to shovel this over to deep fine leg to find the boundary
132 kph, cramming him for room again on the leg side as Mahela whisks this away
133 kph, fended away off the back foot towards point by Lahiru
135 kph, looks to pull this length ball through midwicket, but doesn't quite get the timing behind it
133 kph, swept away round the wicket to deep fine leg on the full by Mahela
136 kph, digs out a yorker aimed at middle and leg successfully
134 kph, Mitchell gets one now as Lahiru is woefully late on this heave intended to go over extra-cover, with the bat missing the ball completely as it continued on to cannon into his middle stump
134 kph, he won't die trying as right away from ball one he hits this fuller one through the line over cover, with the ball falling just short of a traditional deep cover position
135 kph, low full toss which is sent over midwicket by Mahela for a couple. Takes him into the 90s as well
132 kph, everything Mahela does turns into gold. Another swivel hook off the hips through deep fine leg gets Mahela to 94 now. He is the key for either side here
131 kph, defended from the crease off the back foot by Perera
121 kph, straying on the pads now as this is flicked to deep midwicket. Brings Mahela back on strike. He is just a blow away on 94

125 kph, unfortunately for all present at the Saxton Oval, Mahela will fall just six short as he looked to play the umpteenth "run-another-down-to-third man" stroke outside his off stump, but ends up hitting it a bit finer than he would have liked as this one goes straight into Ronchi's gloves. Is given a rousing ovation as he walks off the pitch
134 kph, looks for the hoick down long on as he is late on this one outside his off stump
117 kph, slower ball on the pads which is clipped away effectively
119 kph, once again straying on the pads towards the same general direction. Mendis wanted two, but Perera was not at all interested as he sent back his partner
128 kph, gets this one high on the bat as this bobbles high to square leg
131 kph, glides this one outside off to the fielder at third man

134 kph, another Sri Lankan wicket almost falls as Perera looked for the hoick over midwicket, but ends up getting a thick outside edge which falls dangerously close to deep fine leg, with the ball reaching him on the bounce
131 kph, this time Mendis is able to get under one as he sends this high over backward square for six. Flick of the wrists as this was sent over that region. Brilliant stuff
131 kph, bowls this one quite wide outside off as Mendis is forced to reach after it, getting this to streak away through third man
132 kph, tries out the wide yorker, but gets it well too wide, and full while we are at it

127 kph, Perera is looking to hit out as he mistimes one, with the intention of going over extra-cover, with Brendon McCullum running hard to his right to take a diving catch. Excellent fielding in the end from NZ to pluck another useful wicket
131 kph, is late on this length ball outside his off stump as Ronchi collects from behind
118 kph, slower ball which is driven firmly to the man at cover
125 kph, tries out a slightly wide, full delivery which Kula is unable to get bat on
119 kph, tries to squirt away Mitchell through backward point, with the ensuing fumble by the fielder allowing him the opportunity

129 kph, sees Mendis backing away to the leg side so follows him with an even wider one, which ends up not being called anyways by the umpire as the batsman failed to clip it away. Should have been called wide, but not the first time this has happened today
128 kph, ends with another beauty which is dead-batted close to the body as they run a risky single
128 kph, begins with a wide yorker which Mendis is late on as he endeavours to get bat on it

131 kph, and another one bites the dust as this time it is Mendis' turn to depart, looking to heave this low full toss through long on, but instead hitting it high to extra-cover, where Vettori is able to take the catch comfortably
133 kph, just stand and deliver from Kula as he blitzes this one low through extra-cover, but doesn't get enough on it for it to reach the boundary
103 kph, slower ball which almost gets Southee a fourth as he clips this just short of Vettori at midwicket
134 kph, continues around the wicket as Kula is unable to get this away, with the ball ending up crashing onto his pads
132 kph, full again and Kula is unable to do any better than hit this back onto himself as the ball rolls to the off side

you just can't keep Brendon out of the action for too long as Kula hammers this fuller one straight to him. He is unable to catch the ball despite putting in a Jontyesque dive to his right, but picks up the ball after and fires in an insanely quick throw to McClenaghan, who holds onto it before whipping the bails from Kula's end. The batsman was well short of his crease on the replay, so Sri Lanka are now nine down, and New Zealand need just one more to end things prematurely at the Saxton Oval
118 kph, slips one well outside off which, to everyone's surprise and amusement, is called wide by Ian Gould
131 kph, scythes this fuller one high over point, but miscues it
131 kph, not quite got his line right as he slips this down leg. Called wide by the umpire

129 kph, and those two wides just delayed the inevitable it seems as Herath's stay ends as soon as it began. Looking to pull this shorter one through midwicket, but ends up spooning a high chance over mid on which Williamson is able to snag comfortably

inn2.comm: 125 kph, begins with a wide down the leg side which is wided by the umpire straightaway
126 kph, this time nicely behind the line of this length on middle and off
122 kph, shaping in from outside off as this is tucked away to midwicket for the first run off the bat
122 kph, gets swing into the bat as this is defended with a straight bat
124 kph, too loose from Kula as Brendon is able to tickle this one fine down the leg side to bring up a boundary
124 kph, this time slices it away through backward point to get Guptill on strike
119 kph, solid connection from the bat as this is guided down to long off
121 kph, turned away to the leg side by Guptill
120 kph, plants his foot before defending this one in the direction of the bowler
119 kph, shuffles over slightly towards the off side as this is defended away
123 kph, solidly behind the line of this length ball on middle and off
122 kph, punched away by the batsman to the off side, but can't pierce the gap
127 kph, onto the front foot as this is fended away to end the over
123 kph, straying on the hips as McCullum fails to get this away
121 kph, looks to cram him for room with this length ball on off as this tails in. Just about manages to squirt it away though
123 kph, defended with a nice, high elbow to the bowler
124 kph, once again played back to the bowler by Guptill. Looks to be exercising great patience as he looks to build a knock
124 kph, onto the back foot as this is driven straight down to long on for a couple
127 kph, tries to run this one through backward point, but the fielder is on the case
125 kph, able to get this away on the leg side for a single
125 kph, once again worked away to midwicket by the batsman
126 kph, almost chops this one on as he looks for room to free his arms. This one kept quite low off the deck too

125 kph, able to whisk this delivery on the pads behind to backward square leg, with good commitment in the deep from the fielder as he puts in the dive before the boundary to cut off a certain boundary. Ends up being signalled four though after the replays show contact was made with the rope

dropped 126 kph, what has happened here? That little delay may have played on Brendon's mind as he almost gets himself into trouble to this length ball which he inside-edges onto his pad, with the ball lifting to Sangakkara, who fails to take the chance. Big chance that, but it was always a tough one
124 kph, ends the over with a length ball which Brendon is able to get behind of comfortably
121 kph, slapped away through the covers on the up, but some nifty fielding by the inner-ring fielder is able to take most off the pace of it
119 kph, this time onto the pads now as Guptill picks out the fielder at silly mid on
123 kph, width on offer, and short, as Guptill is given his release to find the gap on the off side through sweeper cover and bring up his first boundary
123 kph, this time finds the gap through backward point with another cut

121 kph, Kulasekera has taken the Big Kahuna as McCullum holes out limply to mid on, who moves to his right before reaching up to take the chance. Such an innocuous way to go as Brendon departs the Saxton with just 11 to his name
125 kph, slapped away behind of square on the off side for a couple
122 kph, gets the line wrong as the umpire swivels around to signal wide

124 kph, that is Guptill at his best! Plants his foot to this slightly fuller length from Mathews, lifting the bowler high over long off with the cleanest of strikes. Excellent shot that from the opener
125 kph, sensibly steers this next one in the same channel along the ground to the same fielder
126 kph, defends this one from the crease as the ball bounces harmlessly to the off side
125 kph, chops this one outside off down to third man for a single
125 kph, rocks onto the back foot to tuck this away to mid on
125 kph, defends with soft hands to the off side to end the over
121 kph, glides this wider delivery outside off to third man to get off strike
123 kph, scythed away fiercely off the back foot, but finds the fielder at point in a flash
122 kph, has a waft at this fuller length ball outside off as he looks to drill this through the covers
124 kph, gets nice and tall as he eases this one down to long on
125 kph, driven on the up, but finds the fielder stationed at silly mid off
124 kph, places this one beautifully behind square on the off side with a cut, but not enough for it to beat the third man fielder to the square boundary

124 kph, fuller one honing on the pads as Guptill looks for the flick down the leg side, with his edge flying low to Sangakkara's left, who ends up spilling it. SL think they have shelled a chance, but the umpire signals leg bye
125 kph, on the pads again except this time Williamson is able to clip it away through midwicket

126 kph, Mathew's disciplined line and length has been rewarded as Guptil's stay at the crease comes to an end as he pokes at this back of a length shaping into him, with the resulting edge carrying comfortably to Sangakkara's right
130 kph, cranking it up now is Mathews as this one is defended to the off side by Taylor
126 kph, rocks forward to defend this fuller one just outside off
130 kph, drives this one firmly to the fielder at silly mid off to end the over
123 kph, steered away off the back foot through the third man region for one
117 kph, looks to slice this one away past backward point, but the fielder does well to stop it
120 kph, fires in a bouncer which has Taylor ducking for cover
123 kph, punched away off the back foot, but straight to the fielder in the inner ring
123 kph, runs this one outside off down to short third man
123 kph, fended away towards the general vicinity of long off to end another tight over from the Sri Lankan captain
flighted on middle and leg as Taylor comes down the track to try and whip this through long on
drives this one pitched up outside off firmly to long off
played tentatively from the crease by Kane as he presses forward
shimmies down a touch before getting forward to defend
looks to work this one past the bowler, but Herath is able to move swiftly to his right to collect it
bouncer over the batsman's head, wide called
bouncer over the batsman's head, wide called
good length delivery on off, Williamson comes forward and pushes it to point

short of good length delivery on off, Williamson stays inside the crease and punches it to mid-on and sets off for a quick single, the mid-on fielder has a shy at the non-striker's end, but Williamson was well in
good length delivery on middle, Taylor comes forward and punches it to mid-on
on a length around off, Taylor comes on the front foot and defends it back to the bowler
on a length around off, Taylor comes on the front foot and defends it back to the bowler
Williamson skips down the track and drives it to long-on
shimmies down the track and drives it to cover
just back of a length outside off which is fended away to the off side
punched away off the back foot to the fielder at long off
given room to cut this away through the covers to find deep extra-cover
sliced away behind of square, but short third man is in place to field the ball
gets a leading edge towards the off side as he looked to tuck this away midwicket. The pair run it hard enough to come back for the second
cut away fiercely off the back foot, but straight to the fielder at point
tossed up delivery on off, Williamson comes forward and defends
slips one down the leg side as the turn is helped round the corner to deep fine leg by Williamson
defends this one back to the bowler
defended away with soft hands to the leg side by the right-hander
floated on middle and leg as this is guided down to long on to get Taylor back on strike
driven firmly down to long off this time to end the over
gets some movement back into the right-hander as this is clipped away to the leg side for a quick single
given no room to get this away as he defends this off the back foot
honing on the pads as Williamson is able to get under it and flick it uppishly through midwicket for a boundary. Nothing forced about the shot, just clean execution and timing
drilled straight to the man at mid off
presents a nice, straight bat to Perera as he defends this back to the bowler
looks to work the drop single to the off side, but ends up placing it not quite to where he would have liked it

Herath has taken a big scalp here as Taylor's struggle at the crease is brought to an end. Slides this one just outside off as Taylor gets an under-edge which Sangakkara is able to collect cleanly from behind. Taylor doesn't offer any resistance as he storms away from the crease
looks to firmly drive this one past the bowler, but finds the bowler
this time looking to ease it away on the leg side for one, but just can't place it where he wants
gets forward before defending this to the leg side

tries to squirt this one away through the off side, but the fielder at point is quickly onto it before unleashing a throw at the striker's end, where Elliott, who was looking to get to the other end, turns around in his spot to try and recover his ground, with the resulting drive just making it past the throw at his end. A direct hit would have been interesting though
crouches low before working this one away through the off side
squared up slightly by this back of a length outside off as the ball was played away to the off side with the opening of the face
gets tall before driving this off the back foot through long on
flicks this one uppishly to the fielder at silly mid on, with the ball dying just before it reached him
guides this one elegantly through the covers, looking for two, but is restricted to just the one
delicately runs this one past Sangakkara to find a boundary through third man. Safe shot with no fielders nearby
this time targets the man at silly mid off to end the over
defended softly to the off side by Elliott
onto the back foot as this is defended with a nice, straight bat
rocks forward to defend this one away to the off side
once again unable to find the gap on the off side
crouches low to defend as the ball ends up being squirted away to the leg side
brings the bat down in the nick of time to work this just to the right of Rangana to end a maiden over
tucked away off the pads to deep fine leg for a couple
defended to the man at mid off by Williamson
fails to work this one away as the ball carries towards the vicinity of mid off
this time on middle and leg as Williamson is unable to pierce the gap, this time through midwicket
tucked away towards square leg for an easy single
runs this one with an open face down to third man to end the over
played away uppishly through the leg side as Elliott did not look too comfortable
manages to pickup a single through the leg side and get off strike
manages to pierce the gap down to deep square leg to pickup one
uses the feet to get to the pitch and work this behind to deep backward square
goes round the wicket now as this time Williamson waits before tucking it away on the leg side
this time employs the sweep but is late on it as the Sri Lankans go up for a half shout for LBW
able to whip away this short of a length ball on the leg side to deep fine leg
reaches out to steer this one behind to third man for a single
once again straying on the pads as this is glanced behind to fine leg
runs this down to third man to help get him into gear
worked away off the back foot, but can't quite beat the man at long off as they abstain from taking a single
cut away in front of square to deep extra-cover for one
Williamson showing some signs of his frustration as he looks to chip Sachi over mid off, with the ball falling just short of long off
tossed up on middle stump line, Williamson eases it down to long-on
uses the angle of the delivery to work this round the corner with a sweep
tries to force this one away past Sachi, but the bowler is onto it in a flash
tossed up on middle as this is swept powerfully by Williamson to deep square leg
shuffles over a touch to his off stump as he paddles this fine through fine leg for a brace
pushed at rather firmly by the batsman as this streaked away behind to backward point
bowls this on middle and leg as the ball turns away sharply from the right-hander, with Sangakkara taking it from behind and whipping the bails in hope of an overbalancing Elliott
driven authoritatively by Elliott as he uses the skiddy pace to get this to long off
pinpoints the gap between backward square and square leg to perfection with this swivel pull
drilled hard by Elliott to the off side, but stopped in its tracks by the silly mid off fielder
plants his foot to work this single down to long off to keep the strike
eased down to long on for one
rocks onto the back foot before cutting this away through deep extra-cover. Also brings up the NZ 100
floated on middle and off as this is struck back to the bowler
darted in on leg as this is swept fine to deep fine leg
dances down before electing to work this along the ground to the long on fielder
looks to sweep hard at this round-of-the-wicket line from Sachi, with this one landing on one bounce to the deep square leg fielder in force
moves over a touch to his off stump before lighting up the leg side field with his sweep, but finds square leg in a hurry
looks to have grown in confidence as he looks to be more positive down the track, with this one eventually worked away to the off side
driven firmly by Elliott to the man at long off. They are looking more intent on rotating the strike now are Williamson and Elliott
tucked away off the pads to deep midwicket for yet another comfortable single
pushed firmly by Elliott to the left of mid on as long on comes into play
sweeps this fuller one fine down the leg side before setting off for a risky single, which the pair are able to make quite comfortably
flicked away off the pads to deep backward square
advances down before easing this one to long on
chips this one tossed up on middle down to long on for another single
looks to the reverse now to try and guide this down backward point, but is late on it
gets deep in the crease before turning this away off the pads to the leg side
eased off the back foot to backward square to end the over
once again eased down by Williamson to the bloke at long on
advances down the track before directing this one away through cover
defended from the crease by Williamson to the leg side
tucked away to the leg side by the batsman
expertly locates the man at deep backward square with a powerful sweep
driven comfortably to long off to bring up Williamson's fifty. An assured knock with his side surely needing him to continue on here
starts round the wicket as this long hop is belted straight to deep midwicket
steers this one expertly down to long on for one
glanced away off the back foot to deep backward square
tucked away off the pads this time towards the midwicket region
floated on middle and leg as this is swept round the corner to deep fine leg
punched away off the back foot to the fielder at cow corner
turned away off the hips behind square on the leg side
crouches low to diffuse the threat of this Mendis delivery
dances down before positioning himself to drive this to long on
Elliott guilty of playing the sweep shot uppishly over backward square, with the ball landing safely away from the fielder on the bounce
steered this time by Williamson to the fielder at long on
shuffles down before hitting this one straight at silly mid off
uses the feet to good effect to work this one down to long on
rank long hop down the leg side and treated with disdain by Elliott as he crunches his first boundary behind square on the leg side to find the rope
this time shows his finesse outside off with a delicate late cut which just races away past the converging fielder
sensibly executes a drop single just outside off as the pair scamper the run
tries to back away to create room to Dilshan, who is operating round the wicket, but fails to get the desired result
dances down before deciding to go back to his trusted defence
fails to get this one slipped down the leg side through fine leg as his sweepshot doesn't quite come off
tries him out again as this time Elliott middles it, getting enough pace on the ball to find the fine leg boundary
on the back foot as this is turned away for a single through midwicket
looks to pierce the gap on the off side but find the close-in fielder
steered away towards deep extra-cover by the batsman
advances down before easing this to long on to end the over
flighted on middle as this is struck straight back towards the bowler
defended from the crease by Elliott, and with soft hands
defended away, this time to the man at point
directed away by Elliott through the off side as Williamson comes on strike
uses his feet to maneuver this one through midwicket, running the first one hard to complete two in the end
latches onto this fuller one outside off with a powerful sweep to backward square

Mendis has taken the vital breakthrough for Sri Lanka! Elliott, who was looking to bat himself into some form, ends up slicing one to cover as he looked to clear the inner ring on the off side. A tame end to what has been a fighting innings from the No. 5
googly on middle and turning away, Anderson goes back and eases it to long-off
defended by Anderson to the off side
manages to pickup a single through long on
shortens the length a touch, Williamson goes back and punches it to long-on
safely negotiates the final ball of what has been a successful over for Sri Lanka
continues with that angle on leg from round the wicket, as this is swept hard by Williamson to deep fine leg
punched by Anderson, but fails to get it past Sachi who puts in the dive
looking to drive this through the covers, but ends up hitting it a touch straighter
this time forces it away through long on with his trademark whip
this time Williamson gets low to maneuver this one through backward square
goes down the track as he looks to chip over midwicket, with the fielder at the boundary able to stop the ball from hitting the rope
slapped away hard through long off as they are only able to complete one
stands nice and tall before easing this down to long on
plants his foot before working this away through long on for one
dragged down the leg side and all of a sudden Williamson launches into this, sending it high over midwicket to get six. Great sound from the crowd as that was sent up in the air
manages to pickup a single to get Anderson on strike
Anderson unable to force this away through the off side, despite the power used in the shot
slips one down the leg side from round the wicket as this is swept away powerfully to deep backward square
tries to ease this one through mid on, but is thwarted in his attempt
this time driven firmly to long on to get off strike
played with the softest of hands as this is dead-batted by Williamson
short from Dilshan, but Williamson is only able to find deep midwicket as he looked to get it more through cow corner for a boundary
defended to the off side to end the first over of the Powerplay
121 kph, driven on the up through the covers, but cut off by one of the inner-ring fielders
93 kph, excellent slower ball from Kula which has Williamson dead-batting this and then watching his off stump as the ball gets dangerously close to disturbing it
117 kph, in the zone for Williamson as he leans into a nicely balanced drive through the covers for four
121 kph, this time honing on the pads as this is tucked away behind square
98 kph, another good slower ball change-up which Williamson steers down to long off
105 kph, tries a slow bouncer which is pulled fiercely to backward square
advances down before clubbing this through the covers
straying on the leg-stump as this is worked round the corner with a sweep
shimmies down before running this one just outside off towards the slips, with the quick single being executed safely in the end
is well early on this sweep round the corner as he looks to invite the big hit from the Anderson
flighted on middle and powerfully swept by Anderson to square leg
goes down the track before chipping this down to long on to end the over
121 kph, has a go at this short delivery from Kula, but is well late on it
121 kph, gets in a yorker now which is dug out successfully by the batsman
105 kph, hooks this slower bouncer just fine enough to beat the converging fielder from deep square leg
124 kph, steered firmly by the batsman towards long on
119 kph, backs away to the leg side before reaching out to slice this through third man to find the gap
105 kph, reads this slower one early before opening the face to get a single through backward point
continues from round the wicket as this one is pulled emphatically to deep midwicket
slapped away by Corey through long off for one
continues with the leg-stump line as Williamson works this fine to deep fine leg
straying down the leg side and Anderson sees this one early enough to power this over fine leg for a flat-as-a-tack six which just carries over the rope. Crucial runs for NZ
sensibly drills this latest one from Sachi down to the man at long on
creates room to free his arms and slap this away to the cover fielder. The misfield affords Kane a single, and gets NZ to 200
flighted on middle and off and eased down to long off
tucked away off the pads but can't get it past the midwicket fielder
darted in just outside leg as Anderson goes for the leg-side flick square off the wicket
Williamson able to shimmy to the ball before chipping this one cleanly over midwicket to get another useful boundary
eased away off the back foot to the fielder at long on
Anderson's turn to use his feet, but only succeeds in drilling this one straight to the midwicket fielder
clipped away square off the wicket on the leg side for a single
shows his interpretation of the reverse sweep as this is paddled over to what would have been his extra-cover region
flighted on middle and swept powerfully by the allrounder to deep square leg
eased away off the pads to square leg for one
enormous six from Anderson, this one high and mighty over midwicket as he gets nicely under this flighted delivery on middle and leg. This one sailed high over before landing back a couple of rows
sensibly hits this next one towards long off to retain the strike
continues to operate on a leg-stump line as he gets this one wrong
tucked away off the back foot to long on
dances down before clipping this to the long on fielder
sweeps this one powerfully behind square on the leg side, but finds the fielder
full and just outside off as this is helped down to long on
clipped away square off the wicket on the leg side for one

Kane brings up yet another crucial hundred for his side with a punch through long off as he accepts warm applause across the Saxton Oval. He is turning into the rock of this NZ batting order. Another sublime knock under pressure from the young batsman, who continues to make a name for himself on the international scene. His team would like him to continue on from here though
131 kph, fires in a yorker on middle which is dug out by the batsman
130 kph, darts in a slightly wide yorker which Anderson tries to get away, but finds the fielder on the off side
131 kph, once again targeting the covers, but finds the fielder on the off side
132 kph, drilled firmly to the deep extra-cover fielder by Anderson
135 kph, yorker on leg which is chipped by Williamson over midwicket, just getting over the fielder, as the pair run a brace

136 kph, and he has bowled 'im! Williamson, again looking to clip this through midwicket, walks too far across his stumps as he offers Perera a glimpse of the leg stump, which he hits. Ends an outstanding knock of 103 which has put NZ firmly in control and on their way
helped round the corner to backward square as they fail to grab a single
steered this time through mid on for one
tries to get this one away through the leg side, but the umpire signals wide
this time is able to middle it more effectively to find deep fine leg
backs away before looking to guide this through cow corner, with Kula doing well in the deep to cut this off before the boundary
straying on the pads as this is worked round the corner to deep fine leg, with the fielder at deep square leg coming hard to his left to cut this before the rope
another powerful sweep which Chandimal ends up over-running at deep square leg, with the ball rushing behind him to find the rope. Mathews would be let down by that fielding effort in the deep
137 kph, targeting the stumps of middle and leg as this is clipped behind square on the leg side
133 kph, looking to get this away through long on, but ends up inducing an outside edge which streaks away to third man
135 kph, looking for the blockhole as this really low full toss is chipped away low through midwicket, with the fielder putting in a dive low to his left, but unable to snag the chance

133 kph, huge appeal for LBW by Perera as he is absolutely positive he has trapped his man in front. When the umpire remains unmoved though, the two batsmen, who don't quite make it to their ends, end up just sauntering back. Dilshan, who is wise to the situation, keenly fires in a throw at Anderson's end, and hits the target with the batsman just short of his crease. This is a big wicket in the context of the game as he threatened to take this match away. Great thinking to fire in a throw at his end
135 kph, fires in another full delivery on middle which is clipped away for one by Vettori
139 kph, drills this one straight to long off to end a successful over for the visitors
121 kph, able to ease this one outside off down to long off
120 kph, tucked away off the pads by Vettori as a good flat throw from the deep keeps them to just the one
101 kph, slower ball outside off which is drilled straight at Mathews' shoulder, who looks to be in a bit of pain after he fielded the ball
121 kph, delivered in the same channel as this time the batsman is able to get it away to deep extra-cover
102 kph, slower ball bouncer going across the batsman as Vettori drags this one down to just about manage a single and get off strike
123 kph, gets nice and low before crunching this past the bowler to long off

135 kph, big moment this. Hammers this fuller length ball pitched from round the wicket to get this high over mid off to find the cover boundary. Didn't quite time his jump there, but this was always going at a rate of knots
135 kph, what a blow! Ronchi has turned this match on its head with two big hits. This time is fed a fuller one on middle which he gets nicely under and lifts high over long on for six

131 kph, Perera looking for the blockhole as this one is turned into a low full toss which he heaves over cow corner, but doesn't quite get the placement right on it for it to hit the rope. These three balls have effectively made it NZ's game to lose now
104 kph, slower ball on off which is drilled hard at Mathews at mid off, who puts in a wonderful diving stop
131 kph, sayonara! Ronchi waits, then gets under this Perera length delivery to strike this cleanly over long off this time for yet another six. Ronchi has taken over at the Saxton Oval!

104 kph, no need for the extra balls. Ronchi has just leveled the scores with another mighty blow. Saw this slower ball early before waiting and then dropping the back knee to send yet another one high over long off. The crowd is over the moon, and New Zealand require just one to take a 2-1 series lead
Vettori sends everyone at the Oval on their merry way with a scythe behind square on the off side to find the boundary
